{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3673549,"name":"Noah","username":"Noah01","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/b38774/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-04T00:20:42.573Z","cooked":"

Hello CD, I want Limelight to align my robot with the reef, I see a lot of codes for this, but I would like to know how to use it to align with the reef this season, a very difficult mission this year, but I would love to know how you dealt with this with the knowledge you had for the season?

Thanks for the help, I’ll start coding for my team, but this thread is for curiosity about other different alignment methods that teams have had.

We found that pathfind worked the most consistently for us. Look at the pathplanner docs for more info. It just works and you only have to tune one thing not a bunch of different things

Noah01:

Limelight to align my robot with the reef

You may be referring to the “servoing” scheme documented by LimeLight.

My team didn’t use LL to that extent. We did use LL to determine the robot position from the nearby AprilTag. That position was combine with the odometry and gyro using the Kalman filter (addVisionMeasurement). Odometry and gyro were used if AprilTag wasn’t in view. We used PathPlanner or you can code the equivalent which is three independent PID controllers on position - forward/backward, left/right, rotate CW/CCW.

Lots of threads covering this

How did your team do auto alignment this year? Programming
This year, for various reasons, for the first time I’ve been in FRC there was a lot of variation in how teams approached auto align in this year’s game. I’ve seen everything from 6328’s mind boggling approach by basically automating all matchplay, to navigating to any branch position, to not auto align at all. And this is only what I’ve seen. So I was wondering - does your team have a somewhat different approach than what you’ve seen normally to auto align? For example, my team had the driver c…
